column5: I much prefer the barren ugliness of the current dirt hole then say a nice green space.  .....oh wait..... we already had the greenspace!!!!  I'd love to strangle the people that though destroying that park was a good idea..  It's been what, 2-3 years and it still sits there and looks like crap?

Are you talking about the fairgrounds off Essa or Park Place the old Molson Park?  I think you are talking about that.  Yeah that blows. I am talking about the Barrie Fairgrounds right at the Essa Rd exit (the horse race track)
Start the car..Start the car..
Yea,Molson park DISTROYED FOR WHAT????????  cabela's is coming,you heard it here first.
Ah yeah, I always get those two mixed up (the names at least)..  Cabelas at the old fairgrounds would be awesome, but if you think that intersection at Essa/400 is bad now, lol..

Not sure if this has been posted here before or not?  http://www.thebarrieexaminer.com/ArticleDisplay.aspx?e=2652110   http://images.mec.ca/media/Images/pdf/100331_MEC_Barrie_Store_PR_v1_m56577569830953438.pdf
Sweet!!!  A few blocks away
Wonder what Sorjurns (sp) thinks of this???????
You mean they might have to be competitive with their prices?  Oh the horror!
I was reffering to the fact that another bigbox store taking away from a small store.

I dunno if I'd call MEC a 'big box store' It's run a bit differently then you average Walmart for example.  I'm sure Sojourns loyal customers also won't be going anywhere.  They have some great stuff, but unless you are buying something during a wicked sale, you're paying way to much.
You guys will like MEC when it gets there. I am a member at the one in Burlington. I love their home brands and the fact that there is some Canadian content to be had. Jim
I will be able to get there in 3 minutes.  Only Brian might be closer but that is up for argument.
Bump drafting is your only hope.

I love the variety and specialization of MEC, but I find the prices too high to justify most purchases.  For things like clothing, I don't really care if my cotton is organic or not.  I did however snag a nice GPS unit on sale for 40% off not long ago, which I use all the time.  Also, if you are looking for a quality head lamp, I cant think of any place better to find it.
I'm like 3 blocks away from the new store, both you guys will be eating my dust!!!!
It,s down hill from here, and a quick right then a left.LOL
I make one turn onto Ardagh and it's a straight shot for me
Me too.  I live off Ardagh as well.  We must live pretty close to each other.
Okay what is this, the 3 Barrie Musketeers arguing who's closer, anyway, looked at some of the on line prices, unlikely I'll leave any money there.
I'm extremely close to the fire station just west of Ardagh/Ferndale.
I wasn't impressed when I went to the one in Burlington.

fwiw, the store in burlington is much smaller than other locations.  mec is far from a "big box" store, at last the type of store that i refer to by that label. i won't go on about it, but the community feel and amount of say that each and every member has is really nice.  i don't admire their organic cotton. but the prices on their down-filled items and merino wool base layers are great. i also can't think of a better place to buy one's first down-filled sleeping bag. their prizes are hard to beat. tents are well-built as well... gah, i am a MEC junkie

I find the same stuff at Hikers Haven. LeBarons and some other Toronto stores like Tent City at much more reasonable prices. Last time I was in there I saw some very neat stuff but nothing I would buy for my day to day needs in the outdoors.
how about a Cabela's right beside it and we would be all set....
me too ish.
Oh ya, that would make my day..
How about this move? The vacant land that was the fairground is going to be made into shopping of some kind.  How about a cabela's attached to an ikea.  Everyone in the family would be happy.
I am so out of the loop. What the heck is Mec??
Mountain Equipment Co-op
